definition[0]: the act of persuading someone to do something
example[0]: After a little gentle persuasion, Debbie agreed to let us in.
example[1]: It had taken a great deal of persuasion to get him to accept.
example[2]: She used all her powers of persuasion (=skill at persuading people) to convince Tilly that it was the right thing to do.
definition[1]: a particular type of belief, especially a political or religious one
example[4]: We need people with talent, whatever their political persuasions.
